description: Add emotion analysis and face recognition functionality.

blocks.name: getEmotionalAnalysisAnalytics
blocks.description: Returns the overall impressions from a specific uploaded piece of media.

blocks.name: createEmotionalAnalysis
blocks.description: Create a new media object to be processed.

args.name: source
args.info: The source of the media. URL or file upload.

args.name: landmarks
args.info: Set to 1 to receive the feature points, such as eyes, nose, mouth locations, in the JSON response.

args.name: timeout
args.info: Set timeout in seconds to wait for the media to be processed. Default timeout is 10 seconds. Max timeout allowed is 60 seconds.

blocks.name: getEmotionalAnalysis
blocks.description: Returns the results of a specific uploaded piece of media.

blocks.name: deleteEmotionalAnalysis
blocks.description: Delete media results. It returns the status of the operation.

blocks.name: addFacesToGallery
blocks.description: Takes a photo, finds the faces within it, and stores the faces into a gallery you create.

args.name: image
args.info: Publicly accessible URL, Base64 encoded string or File.

args.name: subjectId
args.info: Defined by you. Is used as an identifier for the face.

args.name: galleryName
args.info: Defined by you. Is used to identify the gallery.

args.name: minHeadScale
args.info: Defined by you. Is used to set the ratio of the smallest face we should look for in the photo. Accepts a value between .015 (1:64 scale) and .5 (1:2 scale). By default it is set at .015 (1:64 scale) if not specified.

args.name: multipleFaces
args.info: If set to true, every face found in your photo will be enrolled under the same `subjectId`.

blocks.name: compareFaces
blocks.description: Takes a photo, finds the face within it, and tries to compare it against a face you have already enrolled into a gallery.

args.name: image
args.info: Publicly accessible URL, Base64 encoded string or File.

args.name: subjectId
args.info: Defined by you. Is used as an identifier for the face.

args.name: galleryName
args.info: Defined by you. Is used to identify the gallery.

blocks.name: recognizeFaces
blocks.description: Takes a photo, finds the faces within it, and tries to match them against the faces you have already enrolled into a gallery.

args.name: image
args.info: Publicly accessible URL, Base64 encoded string or File.

args.name: galleryName
args.info: Defined by you. Is used to identify the gallery.

args.name: minHeadScale
args.info: Defined by you. Is used to set the ratio of the smallest face we should look for in the photo. Accepts a value between .015 (1:64 scale) and .5 (1:2 scale). By default it is set at .015 (1:64 scale) if not specified.

args.name: threshold
args.info: Is used to determine a valid facial match.

args.name: maxNumResults
args.info: Is the maximum number of potential matches that are returned. By default it is set to 10 if not supplied.

blocks.name: detectFaces
blocks.description: Takes a photo and returns the facial features it finds.

args.name: image
args.info: Publicly accessible URL, Base64 encoded string or File.

args.name: minHeadScale
args.info: Defined by you. Is used to set the ratio of the smallest face we should look for in the photo. Accepts a value between .015 (1:64 scale) and .5 (1:2 scale). By default it is set at .015 (1:64 scale) if not specified.

blocks.name: getGalleries
blocks.description: Lists out all of the galleries you have created.

blocks.name: getSingleGalleryFaces
blocks.description: Lists out all of the faces you have enrolled in a gallery.

args.name: galleryName
args.info: Defined by you. Is used to identify the gallery.

blocks.name: deleteSingleGallery
blocks.description: Removes a gallery and all of its subjects.

args.name: galleryName
args.info: Defined by you. Is used to identify the gallery.

blocks.name: deleteFaceFromGallery
blocks.description: Removes a face you have enrolled within a gallery.

args.name: subjectId
args.info: Defined by you. Is used as an identifier for the face.

args.name: galleryName
args.info: Defined by you. Is used to identify the gallery.
